00088 bool C_DeviceLink::set_command_buff(const char * code)
00089 {
00090         if (code == NULL)
00091         {
00092                 errmsg("Invalid code passed to set_command_buff.\n");
00093                 return FALSE;
00094         }
00095         if (strlen(code) > sizeof(m_cmd))
00096         {
00097                 errmsg("temp buffer too large for m_cmd in set_command_buff.\n");
00098                 return FALSE;
00099         }
00100         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
00101 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
00102         _snprintf_s(m_cmd,sizeof(m_cmd),_TRUNCATE,"%c%c%s",REQUEST,DELIM_1,code);
00103 #else
00104         _snprintf(m_cmd,sizeof(m_cmd),"%c%c%s",REQUEST,DELIM_1,code);
00105 #endif
00106         return TRUE;
00107 }

00116 float C_DeviceLink::queryfloat(const char *code)
00117 {
00118         float fval = 0.00;
00119         if (QueryMsg(code) == TRUE)
00120         {
00121                 getval(code, &fval);
00122         } else
00123         {
00124                 errmsg("QueryMsg returned FALSE in queryfloat\n");
00125                 if (HasData() == FALSE)
00126                 {
00127                         errmsg("queryfloat: Query failed to read data from socket.\n");
00128                 }
00129                 fval = 0.00;
00130         }
00131         return fval;
00132 }

00145 bool C_DeviceLink::querystring(const char* code, char* qstr, unsigned int buff_size)
00146 {
00147         if (QueryMsg(code) == TRUE)
00148         {
00149                 if (getparamval(code, qstr, buff_size) == TRUE)
00150                 {
00151                         return TRUE;
00152                 }
00153         } else
00154         {
00155                 errmsg("QueryMsg returned FALSE in querystring\n");
00156                 if (HasData() == FALSE)
00157                 {
00158                         errmsg("Query failed to read data from socket.\n");
00159                 }
00160                 return FALSE;
00161         }
00162         
00163         return FALSE;
00164 }

00175 bool C_DeviceLink::getparamval(const char *code, char* strval, unsigned int buff_size)
00176 {
00177         char temp_buff[256];
00178         memset(temp_buff, NULL, sizeof(temp_buff));
00179         unsigned int tbuff_size = sizeof(temp_buff);
00180         if (get_read_buff(temp_buff, tbuff_size) == FALSE)
00181         {
00182                 errmsg("get_read_buff returned FALSE in getparamval.\n");
00183                 return FALSE;
00184         }
00185         tbuff_size = strlen(temp_buff); //get length of temp_buff to compare to strval size.
00186         if (tbuff_size > buff_size)
00187         {
00188                 errmsg("strval has not been allocated enought space in getparamval.\n");
00189                 return FALSE;
00190         }
00191         
00192         //null out token and set pdest to point at the part of the temp_buff
00193         //that contains the result from a query. i.e if code 80 was passed
00194         //in we look for code 80 in "A/80\0.35" and then grab the 0.35 
00195         char* token = NULL;
00196         token = strstr(temp_buff, code);
00197         if (token == NULL)
00198         {
00199                 errmsg("No matching response in buffer to query in getparamval.\n");
00200                 return FALSE;
00201         }
00202         //Parse to the number of m_ret_cnt delimiters for the code. We don't care about it.
00203         //setting up a max amount to step through so we don't walk off the end of the buffer.
00204         unsigned int sz = strlen(token); 
00205         unsigned int cnt = 0;
00206         unsigned int tokcnt = 0;
00207         while ((token[0] != NULL) && (cnt <= sz) && (tokcnt < m_ret_cnt))
00208         {
00209                 if (token[0] == DELIM_2)
00210                 {
00211                         ++tokcnt;
00212                 }
00213                 ++token;
00214                 ++cnt;
00215         }
00216         //Now get the param value.
00217         unsigned int j = 0;
00218         sz = strlen(token);
00219         char * ptr = NULL;
00220         ptr = strval;
00221         //copying the data to strval for conversion. Why didn't I use strcpy or some variant?
00222         //well, because in 1C's infinite wisdom they chose to use / and \ as delimiters. Since
00223         //some data can render an unescaped series of tokens with \0 that renders most of the
00224         //string functions useless.
00225         while ((token[0] != DELIM_2) & (token[0] != NULL) & (token[0] != DELIM_1) & (j <= sz))
00226         {
00227                 *ptr = *token;
00228                 ++ptr;
00229                 ++token;
00230                 ++j;
00231         }
00232         
00233         if (strval != NULL)
00234         {
00235                 if (strlen(strval) > 0)
00236                 {
00237                         return TRUE;
00238                 }
00239         }
00240 
00241         return FALSE;
00242 }

00302 bool C_DeviceLink::setengfloats(const int eng_num, const char* code, float *engine_part)
00303 {
00304         if ((eng_num < ENGINE_ONE) | (eng_num > ENGINE_FOUR))
00305         {
00306                 errmsg("setengfloats called with invalid engine number.\n");
00307                 return FALSE;
00308         }
00309         char temp_cmd[32];
00310         memset(temp_cmd,NULL,sizeof(temp_cmd));
00311 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
00312         _snprintf_s(temp_cmd,sizeof(temp_cmd),_TRUNCATE,"%s%c%d",code,DELIM_2,eng_num);
00313 #else
00314         _snprintf(temp_cmd,sizeof(temp_cmd),"%s%c%d",code,DELIM_2,eng_num);
00315 #endif
00316         {
00317         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
00318         m_ret_cnt = 2; //set expected return value delimiter count to 2
00319         }
00320         float fval = 0.00;
00321         fval = queryfloat(temp_cmd);
00322         {
00323         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
00324         *engine_part = fval;
00325         m_ret_cnt = 1; //set expected return value delimiter count to 2
00326         }
00327         return TRUE;
00328 }

00384 bool C_DeviceLink::get_read_buff(char* temp_buff, unsigned int buff_size)
00385 {
00386         if (temp_buff[0] != NULL)
00387         {
00388                 errmsg("temp_buff not initialized to NULL in get_read_buff.\n");
00389                 return FALSE;
00390         }
00391         if(m_buff[0] != ANSWER)
00392         {
00393                 errmsg("Not a valid response code in buffer!\n");
00394                 return FALSE;
00395         }
00396         if (buff_size < strlen(m_buff))
00397         {
00398                 errmsg("Insufficient temp buffer size in get_read_buff.\n");
00399                 return FALSE;
00400         }
00401         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
00402         dl_strncpy(temp_buff, m_buff,buff_size);        
00403         return TRUE;
00404 }

00412 bool C_DeviceLink::set_read_buff(const char* temp_buff, unsigned int buff_size)

00416                 MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);

00418                 return TRUE;
00419         }

00421         {
00422                 errmsg("temp buffer size too large for m_buff in set_read_buff.\n");
00423                 return FALSE;
00424         }
00425         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec); 
00426         dl_strncpy(m_buff,const_cast<char *>(temp_buff), sizeof(m_buff));       
00427         return TRUE;
00428 }

00539 void C_DeviceLink::getval(const char* code, int *val)
00540 {
00541         //null out temp and call getparamval
00542         //to set temp equal to the string representation
00543         //of returned val. We then convert it to a float
00544         char temp[64];
00545         memset(temp, NULL, sizeof(temp));
00546         if (getparamval(code, temp, sizeof(temp)) == TRUE)
00547         {
00548                 *val = atoi(temp);
00549         } else
00550         {
00551                 errmsg("getparamval returned FALSE in getval.\n");
00552                 *val = 0;
00553         }
00554 }

00561 void C_DeviceLink::getval(const char* code, float *val)
00562 {
00563         //null out temp and call getparamval
00564         //to set temp equal to the string representation
00565         //of returned val. We then convert it to a float
00566         char temp[256];
00567         memset(temp, NULL, sizeof(temp));
00568         if (getparamval(code, temp, sizeof(temp)) == TRUE)
00569         {
00570                 *val = static_cast<float>(atof(temp));
00571         } else
00572         {
00573                 errmsg("getparamval returned FALSE in getval.\n");
00574                 *val = 0;
00575         }
00576 }

00602 bool C_DeviceLink::Init(FILE *output)
00603 {
00604         //if the calling program passed in file name then log
00605         //to that file. Otherwise log to the console.
00606         if (output == NULL)
00607         {
00608                 dl_output = stderr;
00609         } else
00610         {
00611                 dl_output = output;
00612         }
00613 
00614         if (ReadConfig() == FALSE)
00615         {
00616                 errmsg("Failed to read config file\n");
00617                 m_initialized = FALSE;
00618                 return FALSE;
00619         }
00620         
00621         //setup the UDP client 
00622         m_this_end.sin_port=htons(0);
00623         m_this_end.sin_addr.s_addr=htons(INADDR_ANY);
00624         m_this_end.sin_family=AF_INET;
00625         memset(&m_this_end.sin_zero, 0, sizeof(m_this_end.sin_zero));
00626         m_other_end.sin_port = htons(m_port);
00627         m_other_end.sin_addr.s_addr = inet_addr(m_game_ip);
00628         m_other_end.sin_family = AF_INET;
00629         memset(&m_other_end.sin_zero, 0, sizeof(m_other_end.sin_zero));
00630         WSADATA wsaData;
00631         
00632         //yeah, I know, MFC code but this was easier than rolling my own.
00633         //would have preferred to make this multi-platform. maybe a later
00634         //version.
00635         int retval = 0;
00636         retval = WSAStartup(0x202,&wsaData);
00637 
00638         if (retval != 0) 
00639         {
00640 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00641                 fprintf(output,"WSAStartup failed with error %d\n",retval);
00642 #endif
00643         WSACleanup();
00644         return FALSE;
00645     }
00646 
00647         //create the UDP socket.
00648         m_sock = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_UDP);
00649         if (m_sock == INVALID_SOCKET)
00650         {
00651 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00652                 fprintf(dl_output,"Error in socket call in Init(). Error :%d\n", WSAGetLastError());
00653 #endif
00654                 WSACleanup();
00655                 return FALSE;
00656         }
00657 #pragma warning( push, 3 ) //Microsoft's FD_SET macro causes a Lvl 4 warning. Choosing to ignore it.
00658         FD_SET(m_sock, &ActiveReadFds);
00659 #pragma warning( pop ) // pop back to lvl 4 warning.
00660         //bail if socket creation fails
00661         if (m_sock < 0)
00662         {
00663 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00664                 fprintf(dl_output,"Client: Error Opening socket: Error %d\n",WSAGetLastError());
00665 #endif
00666         WSACleanup();
00667                 return FALSE;
00668         } 
00669         
00670         //bind the socket. bail if fails        
00671         if (bind(m_sock, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr*>(&m_this_end), sizeof(m_this_end)) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00672     {
00673 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00674                 fprintf(dl_output,"Client: Error binding socket: Error %d\n",WSAGetLastError());
00675 #endif
00676         WSACleanup();
00677                 return FALSE;
00678         } 
00679 
00680         if ( connect( m_sock, reinterpret_cast<struct sockaddr*>(&m_other_end), sizeof(m_other_end) ) == SOCKET_ERROR)
00681         {
00682 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00683                 fprintf(dl_output,"Failed to connect. Error %d\n",WSAGetLastError());
00684 #endif
00685                 WSACleanup();
00686                 return FALSE;
00687         }
00688 
00689         m_initialized = TRUE;
00690         return TRUE;
00691 }
00692 
00702 bool C_DeviceLink::SendMsg()
00703 {       
00704         if (IsInitialized() == FALSE)
00705         {
00706                 init_err();
00707                 return FALSE;
00708         }
00709 
00710         int err = 0;
00711         char temp_cmd[80];
00712         memset(temp_cmd, NULL,sizeof(temp_cmd));
00713         if (get_cmd_buff(temp_cmd, sizeof(temp_cmd)) == FALSE)
00714         {
00715                 errmsg("get_cmd_buff returned FALSE in SendMsg.\n");
00716                 return FALSE;
00717      }
00718         int len = static_cast<int>(strlen(temp_cmd));
00719         err = send(m_sock, temp_cmd, len, 0);
00720         if (err == SOCKET_ERROR)
00721         {
00722 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00723                 fprintf(dl_output, "error in SendMSg. Error %d\n",WSAGetLastError());
00724 #endif
00725         WSACleanup();
00726                 return FALSE;
00727         }
00728         return TRUE;
00729 }
00730 
00742 bool C_DeviceLink::ReadMsg()
00743 {
00744         if (IsInitialized() == FALSE)
00745         {
00746                 init_err();
00747                 return FALSE;
00748         }
00749         size_t len = 0;
00750         size_t buff_len = 0;
00751         char temp_buff[256];
00752         memset(temp_buff, NULL, sizeof(temp_buff));
00753         buff_len = sizeof(temp_buff);
00754         memset(&ActiveReadFds, 0x0, sizeof(fd_set));
00755 #pragma warning( disable : 4127) //supressing compiler warning about this macro. Not my macro so can't fix it.
00756         FD_SET(m_sock, &ActiveReadFds);
00757         struct timeval tv;
00758         memset(&tv, 0x0, sizeof(struct timeval));
00759         tv.tv_usec = 250000; //wait no more than .25 of a second.
00760         int chk = select(0, &ActiveReadFds, NULL, NULL, &tv);
00761         if (chk <= 0)
00762         {
00763 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00764                 fprintf(dl_output,"no data to read in ReadMSg()\n");
00765 #endif
00766                 set_has_read_data(FALSE);
00767                 return FALSE;
00768         } 
00769         len = recv(m_sock, temp_buff, buff_len, 0);
00770         if (len == SOCKET_ERROR)
00771     {
00772 #ifdef DEBUG_OUTPUT
00773                 fprintf(dl_output,"Client: Error receiving from socket: Error %d\n",WSAGetLastError());
00774 #endif
00775                 set_has_read_data(FALSE);
00776         WSACleanup();
00777                 return FALSE;
00778         } 
00779         temp_buff[len] = '\0';
00780         buff_len = strlen(temp_buff);
00781         if ((set_read_buff(temp_buff, buff_len) == FALSE) | (buff_len == 0) | (len == SOCKET_ERROR))
00782         {
00783                 errmsg("set_read_buff returned FALSE in ReadMsg,\nor no data was read from the socket");
00784                 set_has_read_data(FALSE);
00785                 return FALSE;
00786         }
00787         set_has_read_data(TRUE);
00788         return TRUE;
00789 }

00797 bool C_DeviceLink::Gear_Is_Up()
00798 {
00799         float fval = 0.00;
00800         fval = queryfloat(DL_GET_GEAR_STATUS);
00801         if (fval > 0.00)
00802         {
00803                 return FALSE;
00804         } else if (fval < 0.00)
00805         {
00806                 errmsg("queryfloat returned an error. -1 was returned.\n");
00807                 return FALSE; 
00808         } else
00809         {
00810                 errmsg("Gear already up in Gear_Is_Up\n");
00811                 return TRUE;            
00812         }
00813 }

00837         } else
00838         {
00839                 ToggleGear();
00840         }
00841         return TRUE;

00866 float C_DeviceLink::GetGearPos(char* gearcode)
00867 {
00868         float gearpos = 0.00;
00869         gearpos = queryfloat(gearcode);
00870         if (gearpos >= 0.00)
00871         {
00872                 return gearpos;
00873         }
00874         errmsg("GetGearPos:queryfloat returned a -1 to GetGearPos\n");
00875         return -1.00;
00876 }
00877 
00881 bool C_DeviceLink::ManualGearDown(void)
00882 {
00883         return toggleswitch(DL_LOWER_GEAR_MAN);
00884 }

00889 bool C_DeviceLink::ManualGearUp(void)
00890 {
00891         return toggleswitch(DL_RAISE_GEAR_MAN);
00892 }
00900 bool C_DeviceLink::ReadConfig()
00901 {
00902 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
00903         FILE *fp = NULL;
00904         errno_t err = 0;
00905         err = fopen_s(&fp, "config.ini", "r");
00906         if (err != 0)
00907         {
00908                 errmsg("Cannot open config file.\n");
00909                 exit(1);
00910         }
00911 #else
00912         FILE *fp = NULL;
00913         fp = fopen("config.ini", "r");
00914         if (fp == NULL)
00915         {
00916                 errmsg("Cannot open config file.\n");
00917                 exit(1);
00918         }
00919 #endif
00920         char temp[80];
00921         memset(temp, NULL, sizeof(temp));
00922         fgets(temp, 19,fp);
00923         if (temp[1] != 'D')
00924         {
00925                 errmsg("Invalid config file\n");
00926                 fclose(fp);
00927                 return FALSE;
00928         }
00929 
00930         fgets(temp, 19, fp);
00931         if (temp[0] == 'P')
00932         {
00933                 char* pdest = strstr(temp,"=") + 1;
00934                 if (pdest == NULL)
00935                 {
00936                         errmsg("Invalid IP address in config file.\n");
00937                         fclose(fp);
00938                         return FALSE;
00939                 }
00940                 m_port = static_cast<u_short>(atoi(pdest));
00941                 if ((m_port == 0) )
00942                 {
00943                         errmsg("Invalid port number in config file.\n");
00944                         fclose(fp);
00945                         return FALSE;
00946                 }
00947         } else
00948         {
00949                 errmsg("Invalid config file\n");
00950                 fclose(fp);
00951                 return FALSE;
00952         }
00953 
00954         fgets(temp,19,fp);
00955         if (temp[0] == 'I')
00956         {
00957                 char* pdest = strstr(temp,"=") + 1;
00958                 if (pdest == NULL)
00959                 {
00960                         errmsg("Invalid IP address in config file.\n");
00961                         fclose(fp);
00962                         return FALSE;
00963                 }
00964                 dl_strncpy(m_game_ip,pdest,sizeof(m_game_ip));
00965                 if (m_game_ip[0] == NULL)
00966                 {
00967                         errmsg("Invalid IP address in config file.\n");
00968                         fclose(fp);
00969                         return FALSE;
00970                 }
00971         } else
00972         {
00973                 errmsg("Invalid config file\n");
00974                 fclose(fp);
00975                 return FALSE;
00976         }       
00977 
00978         fclose(fp);
00979         return TRUE;
00980 }
00981 
00986 bool C_DeviceLink::IsInitialized()
00987 {
00988         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
00989         return m_initialized;
00990 }
00991 
00997 bool C_DeviceLink::QueryMsg(const char* code)
00998 {
00999         //send the query string and read the subsequent response.
01000         if (set_command_buff(code) == FALSE)
01001         {
01002                 errmsg("set_command_buff returned FALSE in QueryMsg.\n");
01003                 return FALSE;
01004         }
01005         if (SendMsg() == TRUE)
01006         {
01007                 if(ReadMsg() == TRUE)
01008                 {
01009                         if (HasData() == TRUE)
01010                         {
01011                                 return TRUE;
01012                         } else
01013                         {
01014                                 errmsg("No data read from socket. Server may not be up\n");
01015                                 return FALSE;
01016                         }
01017                 } else
01018                 {
01019                         errmsg("Read failed. No data read from socket. Server may not be up\n");
01020                         return FALSE;
01021                 }
01022         } else
01023         {       
01024                 errmsg("Catastrophic socket failure. SendMsg failed.\n");
01025                 set_has_read_data(FALSE);
01026                 return FALSE;
01027         }
01028 
01029 }
01030 
01034 bool C_DeviceLink::HasData()
01035 {
01036         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
01037         return m_readdata;
01038 }
01039 
01048 bool C_DeviceLink::GetDLVersion(char* verstr, unsigned int buff_size)
01049 {
01050         if (buff_size < sizeof(m_dl_ver))
01051         {
01052                 errmsg("Calling routine allocated insuffcient buffer. Must be at least 64 bytes!\n");
01053                 return FALSE;
01054         }
01055         if (querystring(DL_GET_VERSION, m_dl_ver, sizeof(m_dl_ver)) == TRUE)
01056         {
01057                 dl_strncpy(verstr, m_dl_ver, buff_size);
01058                 return TRUE;
01059         }
01060         errmsg("querystring returned FALSE to GetDLVersion.\n");
01061         return FALSE;
01062 }
01063 
01069 bool C_DeviceLink::ValidGet(const char* code)
01070 {
01071         char newcode[64];
01072         char temp[64];
01073         memset(temp, NULL,sizeof(temp));
01074         memset(newcode, NULL,sizeof(newcode));
01075 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
01076         _snprintf_s(newcode,sizeof(newcode),_TRUNCATE,"%s%c%s",DL_ACCESS_GET,DELIM_2,code);
01077 #else
01078         _snprintf(newcode,sizeof(newcode),"%s%c%s",DL_ACCESS_GET,DELIM_2,code);
01079 #endif
01080 
01081         if (querystring(newcode, temp, sizeof(temp)) == TRUE)
01082         {
01083                 return TRUE;
01084         }
01085         return FALSE;
01086 }

01091 float C_DeviceLink::GetTOD()
01092 {
01093         float tod = 0.00;
01094         tod = queryfloat(DL_TOD);
01095         if (tod >= 0.00)
01096         {
01097                 return tod;
01098         }
01099                 errmsg("queryfloat returned a -1 to GetTOD\n");
01100                 return 0.00;
01101 }
01102 
01110 bool C_DeviceLink::GetAircraftID(char *ac, unsigned int buff_size)
01111 {       
01112         char temp[64];
01113         memset(temp, NULL, sizeof(temp));
01114         if (buff_size < sizeof(temp))
01115         {       
01116                 errmsg("Insuffcient buffer allocated for aircraft type name.  Must be at least 64 bytes.\n");
01117                 return FALSE;
01118         }
01119         if (querystring(DL_GET_PLANE, temp, buff_size) == TRUE)
01120         {
01121                 //copy temp into the buffer pointed to by ac but let's be safe and
01122                 //do a sanity check on ac while we are at it.
01123                 dl_strncpy(ac, temp, buff_size);
01124                 return TRUE;
01125         }
01126         return FALSE;
01127 }

01343 int C_DeviceLink::GetMags(const int eng_num)
01344 {
01345         if ((eng_num < ENGINE_ONE) | (eng_num > ENGINE_FOUR))
01346         {
01347                 errmsg("GetMags called with invalid engine number.\n");
01348                 return -1;
01349         }
01350         char tmp_cmd[64];
01351         memset(tmp_cmd,NULL,sizeof(tmp_cmd));
01352 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
01353         _snprintf_s(tmp_cmd,sizeof(tmp_cmd),_TRUNCATE,"%s%c%d",DL_GET_MAG,DELIM_2,eng_num);
01354 #else
01355         _snprintf(tmp_cmd,sizeof(tmp_cmd),"%s%c%d",DL_GET_MAG,DELIM_2,eng_num);
01356 #endif
01357         int ival = 0;
01358         ival = queryint(tmp_cmd);
01359         if (ival <= 0)
01360         {
01361                 errmsg("Invalid number of Mags returned from queryint().\n");
01362                 return -1;
01363         }
01364         return ival;
01365 }

01373 bool C_DeviceLink::FeatherEngine(void)
01374 {

01377         if (ival == 1)
01378         {
01379                 return toggleswitch(DL_TOGGLE_FEATHER);
01380         } else
01381         {
01382                 return FALSE;
01383         }
01384 }

01389 int C_DeviceLink::GetNumEngines(void)
01390 {

01394         {
01395                 errmsg("Invalid number of Mags returned from queryint(DL_GET_MAG).\n");
01396                 return -1;
01397         }
01398         return ival;
01399 }

01541 bool C_DeviceLink::Set_Engine_Data(const int eng_num)
01542 {
01543         if ((eng_num < ENGINE_ONE) | (eng_num > ENGINE_FOUR))
01544         {
01545                 errmsg("Set_Engine_Data called with invalid engine number.\n");
01546                 return FALSE;
01547         }
01548         //since the response from the server will include engine num we need to set
01549         //the parameter parser to 2.
01550         m_ret_cnt = 2;
01551         /********************************************************
01552         * We are going to make a special call to devicelink to  *
01553         * take advantage of the multiple query on a line aspect *
01554         * of the  engine data.                             *
01555         ********************************************************/
01556         //build the query string
01557         char temp_cmd[80];
01558         memset(temp_cmd, NULL,sizeof(temp_cmd));
01559 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
01560         _snprintf_s(temp_cmd,sizeof(temp_cmd),_TRUNCATE,"64\\%d/66\\%d/68\\%d/70\\%d/72\\%d/74\\%d\0",eng_num,eng_num,eng_num,eng_num,eng_num,eng_num);
01561 #else
01562         _snprintf(temp_cmd,sizeof(temp_cmd),"64\\%d/66\\%d/68\\%d/70\\%d/72\\%d/74\\%d\0",eng_num,eng_num,eng_num,eng_num,eng_num,eng_num);
01563 #endif
01564         if ( QueryMsg(temp_cmd) == FALSE )
01565         {
01566                 errmsg("QueryMsg returned false in Set_Engine_Data.\n");
01567                 return FALSE;
01568         }
01569 
01570         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
01571         getval(DL_GET_MANIFOLD,&m_engine[eng_num].manifold);
01572         getval(DL_GET_TEMP_WATER,&m_engine[eng_num].temp_water);
01573         getval(DL_GET_TEMP_OILOUT,&m_engine[eng_num].temp_oilout);
01574         getval(DL_GET_TEMP_OILIN,&m_engine[eng_num].temp_oilin);
01575         getval(DL_GET_TEMP_CYL,&m_engine[eng_num].temp_cylinders);
01576         getval(DL_GET_RPM,&m_engine[eng_num].rpm);
01577         m_ret_cnt = 1;
01578         return TRUE;
01579 }
01580

01870 bool C_DeviceLink::Set_IAS(void)
01871 {
01872         float fval = 0.00;

01877                 return FALSE;
01878         }

01880         m_ias = fval;

02194 bool C_DeviceLink::Set_Power(const int eng_idx, float pos)
02195 {
02196         char code[64];
02197         memset(code,NULL,sizeof(code));
02198 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
02199         _snprintf_s(code,sizeof(code),_TRUNCATE,"%s%c%d",DL_SET_POWER,DELIM_2,eng_idx);
02200 #else
02201         _snprintf(code,sizeof(code),"%s%c%d",DL_SET_POWER,DELIM_2,eng_idx);
02202 #endif  
02203         bool flag = false;
02204         flag = setctrl(code, pos);
02205         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02206         m_engine[eng_idx].power = pos; //go ahead and store the new value
02207         return flag;
02208 }

02444 bool C_DeviceLink::SetAllInstruments(void)
02445 {
02446         char cmd[80];
02447         memset(cmd, NULL, sizeof(cmd));
02448 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
02449         _snprintf_s(cmd,sizeof(cmd),_TRUNCATE,"%s",DL_ALL_INST);
02450 #else
02451         _snprintf(cmd,sizeof(cmd),"%s",DL_ALL_INST);
02452 #endif
02453         if (FALSE == QueryMsg(cmd))
02454         {
02455                 errmsg("error in C_DeviceLink::SetAllInstruments.\n");
02456                 return FALSE;
02457         }       
02458         // set IAS
02459         float fval = 0.00;
02460         getval(DL_GET_IAS, &fval);
02461 
02462         {
02463         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02464         m_ias = fval;
02465         }
02466         // set Vario
02467         fval = 0.00;
02468         getval(DL_GET_VARIO, &fval);
02469         {
02470         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02471         m_vario = fval;
02472         }
02473         // set Slip
02474         fval = 0.00;
02475         getval(DL_GET_SLIP, &fval);
02476         {
02477         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02478         m_slip = fval;
02479         }
02480         // set turn
02481         fval = 0.00;
02482         getval(DL_GET_TURN, &fval);
02483         {
02484         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02485         m_turn = fval;
02486         }
02487         // set Angular Speed
02488         fval = 0.00;
02489         getval(DL_GET_ANG_SPD, &fval);
02490         {
02491         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02492         m_ang_spd = fval;
02493         }
02494         // set Altimeter
02495         fval = 0.00;
02496         getval(DL_GET_ALT, &fval);
02497         {
02498         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02499         m_alt = fval;
02500         }
02501         // set Azimuth
02502         fval = 0.00;
02503         getval(DL_GET_AZI, &fval);
02504         {
02505         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02506         m_azimuth = fval;
02507         }
02508         // set Beacon Azimuth
02509         fval = 0.00;
02510         getval(DL_GET_BEACON_AZI, &fval);
02511         {
02512         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02513         m_beacon_azimuth = fval;
02514         }
02515         // set Roll
02516         fval = 0.00;
02517         getval(DL_GET_ROLL, &fval);
02518         {
02519         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02520         m_roll = fval;
02521         }
02522         // set Pitch
02523         fval = 0.00;
02524         getval(DL_GET_PITCH, &fval);
02525         {
02526         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02527         m_pitch = fval;
02528         }
02529         // set Fuel
02530         fval = 0.00;
02531         getval(DL_GET_FUEL, &fval);
02532         {
02533         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02534         m_fuel = fval;
02535         } 
02536         return TRUE;
02537 }
02538 
02544 bool C_DeviceLink::Query_Weapon(WeapType weap)
02545 {
02546         char* code = NULL;
02547         switch (weap)
02548         {
02549                 case MG:
02550                         code = DL_GET_WEAP1;
02551                         break;
02552                 case CANNON:
02553                         code = DL_GET_WEAP2;
02554                         break;
02555                 case ROCKETS:
02556                         code = DL_GET_WEAP3;
02557                         break;
02558                 case BOMBS:
02559                         code = DL_GET_WEAP4;
02560                         break;
02561                 case MGCANNON:
02562                         code = DL_GET_WEAP1_2;
02563                         break;
02564                 default:
02565                         code = DL_GET_WEAP1_2;
02566                         break;
02567         }
02568         int ival = 0;
02569         ival = queryint(code);
02570         if ((0.00 > ival) || (1.00 < ival))
02571         {
02572                 errmsg("queryfloat returned an error in Query_Weapon.\n");
02573                 return FALSE;
02574         } 
02575         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02576         m_weap[weap] = ival;
02577         return TRUE;
02578 }

02776 
02781 bool C_DeviceLink::JumpToCockpit(const int pitnum)
02782 {
02783         switch (pitnum)
02784         {
02785         case 1:
02786                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_PILOT);
02787                 break;
02788         case 2:
02789                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS2);
02790                 break;
02791         case 3:
02792                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS3);
02793                 break;
02794         case 4:
02795                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS4);
02796                 break;
02797         case 5:
02798                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS5);
02799                 break;
02800         case 6:
02801                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS6);
02802                 break;
02803         case 7:
02804                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS7);
02805                 break;
02806         case 8:
02807                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS8);
02808                 break;
02809         case 9:
02810                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS9);
02811                 break;
02812         case 10:
02813                 return toggleswitch(DL_JUMP_TO_POS10);
02814                 break;
02815         default:
02816                 return false;
02817         }
02818 }
02819 
02823 bool C_DeviceLink::Query_Tailwheel(void)
02824 {
02825         int ival = 0;
02826         ival = queryint(DL_GET_TAILWHEEL);
02827         if ((0.00 > ival) || (1.00 < ival))
02828         {
02829                 errmsg("queryfloat returned an error in Query_Tailwheel.\n");
02830                 return FALSE;
02831         } 
02832         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02833         m_tailwheel = ival;
02834         return TRUE;
02835 }
02839 int C_DeviceLink::Get_Tailwheel(void)
02840 {
02841         MC_Lock m_Lock(&my_critsec);
02842         return m_tailwheel;
02843 }
02844 /* \brief sets the tailwheel on or off
02845 \return \b boolean
02846 */
02847 bool C_DeviceLink::Set_Tailwheel(void)
02848 {
02849         return toggleswitch(DL_TOGGLE_TAILWHEEL);
02850 }

02877 bool C_DeviceLink::Set_Weapon(WeapType weap, int ival)
02878 {
02879         char* code = NULL;
02880         switch (weap)
02881         {
02882                 case MG:
02883                         code = DL_GET_WEAP1;
02884                         break;
02885                 case CANNON:
02886                         code = DL_GET_WEAP2;
02887                         break;
02888                 case ROCKETS:
02889                         code = DL_GET_WEAP3;
02890                         break;
02891                 case BOMBS:
02892                         code = DL_GET_WEAP4;
02893                         break;
02894                 case MGCANNON:
02895                         code = DL_GET_WEAP1_2;
02896                         break;
02897                 default:
02898                         code = DL_GET_WEAP1_2;
02899                         break;
02900         }
02901         char tmp_cmd[32];
02902         memset(tmp_cmd,NULL,sizeof(tmp_cmd));
02903 #if _MSC_VER >= 1400
02904         _snprintf_s(tmp_cmd,sizeof(tmp_cmd),_TRUNCATE,"%s%c%d",code,DELIM_2,ival);
02905 #else
02906         _snprintf(tmp_cmd,sizeof(tmp_cmd),"%s%c%d",code,DELIM_2,ival);
02907 #endif
02908         if (set_command_buff(tmp_cmd) == FALSE)
02909         {
02910                 errmsg("set_command_buff returned FALSE in Set_Weapon.\n");
02911                 return FALSE;
02912         }
02913         if (SendMsg()== TRUE)
02914         {
02915                 return TRUE;
02916         } else
02917         {
02918                 return FALSE;
02919         }
02920 }
02921
